text: Bottle received through the Eden Ice Cider club. Clear deep golden pour with nice legs. Big apple caramel aroma. Vanilla and calvados. Sweet and balanced fruity sour. Viscous round tart mouth. Bit boozy. Lovely!
Very nice and rich ice cider with loads of complex flavours! The barrels sure added another level to this. Very nice!
Bottle thanks to Alex. Clear orange beer with almost no head. Apple aroma, woody, fruity, overripe apples. Apple flavor, fruity, yeast notes, slightly boozy.

Bottle... Pours clear and yellow with no head and nearly no legs. The aroma is a perfect blend of fresh Red Delicious, Macintosh and lightly pungent apples that have been cut in halves and laid out on someones back porch for 12 hours on a hot August day. Full-bodied with a thick, velvety mouthfeel and minimal carbonation. The flavor is quite tart, to the point that the acidity becomes a bit overbearing. Still luxurious and highly enjoyable nonetheless. Bottle courtesy of darkguardian!

Bottle at the ice cider tasting at James. Pours a clear amber. Big fat apples on the nose, soft wood, a touch of caramel. Medium-bodied, caramel, soft acid, a nice bit of warmth and wood. Wood, soft apple and caramel, a touch of acidity. Acid, tartness, warming wood and lingering warmth.

Sample at the tasting room. Clear gold pour. Aroma is rich, nice candied apple, caramel, vanilla, light volatile alcohol, definitely pick up a touch of spirit in the nose. Taste is sweet, very light acidity, nice mellow vanilla oak flavor, mild distilled alcohol warmth, I like how well it goes together without the alcohol overpowering the (excellent!) base cider. Palate is full bodied with a somewhat drier feeling finish than the regular heirloom, I feel the spirit contributes to this a lot. Tasty.

sampled at northern eastern kingdom tasting center, newport, vt. unclear bright gold pour with some stunning legs, shiny. chewy red fruits, dense apple caramel, tasty apple sauce with brown sugar, gently woodsy - nicely integrated - no spirit notes imparted per se, controlled level of sweetness - oaky honey caramel; combined with on-the-spot acidity. flat carbonation, medium to full body - oily; very lightly tart, sweet, warming and spicy-woodsy finish. good brandy barrel integration. much enjoyed!

On-site @ Eden:

Gold in color. Liquer aroma with peach and brown sugar. This is intense in taste. Like the sweetest cider Ive had but its very good. Apple brandy is present, a little alcohol burn and lingering finish.
Bottle - pours orange gold - nose/taste of apple brandy, oak, caramel apple - medium body
Bottle. Good pour with no head. Sweet Apple, cinnamon, sugar aromas. Sweet apple, cinnamon, tart and sweet tones.

375 mL bottle. Clear golden body. Smells of sharply acidic apples. Taste is immensely tart up front. Really intense. Sweetness takes over in the back end, which it really needs. I appreciate the tartness up front, but its really intense and definitely needs the sweetness the cut it down a bit.

Bottle at Colony Clubs ANXO event. Clear deep golden color with amber hues. Aroma is dusty with light funk, tannins, toasted caramel. Taste is complex, semi dry, tannins. Not nearly as sweet as most ice ciders Ive had. Delicious.

3 oz bottle pour at Colony Club during the Anxo pop-up event. Clear golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of cheesy funk, sweet apples. Tastes of sweet tart apples, light booze, sweet syrup. Light body with a dry finish. Nicely masked alcohol.

How: Sample (1½ oz) at Northern Kingdom Tasting Center. 

>>> A unique and enjoyable brandy barrel-aged ice cider that turned out to be a bit boozy but is still well balanced by a sharp acidity and interesting oak and barrels features.

-  Bright golden with orangey tints leaving nice sticky legs on the glass. 
-  Overripe apples combine with caramel, brandy, oak and wood spiciness for a complex flavor profile. 
-  Despite an average ABV for an ice cider, this one is a bit boozy because of the brandy barrel-aging. Not to the point of being harsh though and I think the brandy barrel features still brought more positive than negative aspects to this ice cider. 
-  Acidity is sharp and that was needed to bring some balance to an ice cider where the alcohol (and to a lesser extent the sweetness) are more present than in your usual ice cider. 
-  Body is full. Mouthfeel is liquorous and a bit oily. Warming and a tiny bit hot finish. Mouth coating sweetness is cut by a sharp acidity nicely. 
-  Its far from the level of their Northern Spy in terms of the uniqueness character brought by the barrels to the Ice Cider, but its still a pretty fun, tasty and unique experience. 

Flavors:  Overriple apples, caramel, oak, wood spiciness, brandy, alcohol, musty notes.
Bottle, pours cloudy golden with small white head. Notes of bright caramel apples, light cheese, and some apple must. Light to medium body. Very tart and juicy ice cider.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2015 Bottle from craft beer cellar in Waterbury. Pours a bright golden with thin white ring. Aroma is musky barrel, Apple skins, funky Apple and sauce. Mouthfeel is medium to rich bodied with notes of sweet honey caramel apple, Apple pie, funky barrel and oak.
